page.title: 16PORTHMADOG TOURISM
page.content: Porthmadog is situated on the west coast of Wales,where there are many beaches.It is a small,very well planned country town with all the streets leading on to the main street. In the winter it is fairly quiet but because of the nearby{beaches},the {Festiniog Railway}and easy access to {Snowdonia}the population is multiplied five times from Easter to September. Tourism is the main source of income as there is hardly any other work available.Many shops -craft & gift shops,cafes- cater solely for the tourist trade.Several of these close during the winter months,but open 7 days a week during the busy summer season.There are a few hotels and many B&B facilities available.A new Welsh Tourist Office was opened in 1985 providing local information and bed-booking facilities.
